Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
CAN: The student can draw two different habitats, attempting one on land and one in water, but with some difficulty distinguishing features clearly.
The student can illustrate at least two different living things in each habitat, though with potential inaccuracies in representing typical inhabitants.
The student makes an attempt to show plants like trees or grasses in the land habitat, though may inaccurately depict proportions or common species.
The student may show some simple animals like squirrels in the land habitat, but lacks variety or detail.
The student can suggest basic aquatic animals like fish in the water habitat but may ignore other aquatic life forms.
CANNOT: The student is unable to consistently show three distinct living things in each habitat (limited understanding or examples).
The student struggles to depict specific kinds of plants or animals unique to each habitat, often mixing up land and water examples (e.g., placing a fish on land).
The student fails to show different types of aquatic plants (student may not be aware of their existence).
The student cannot effectively use their drawings to compare or identify patterns between the habitats (may not understand comparison).
